etymology.description: 戈(戈) (gē, "halberd") + 鬼(鬼) (guǐ, "ghost") = halberd weapon + phonetic component -> a type of halberd
etymology.interpretation: The character 戣(戣) (kuí, "type of halberd") combines 戈(戈) (gē, "halberd") as a semantic component indicating the weapon aspect, with 鬼(鬼) (guǐ, "ghost") as a phonetic component to hint at its pronunciation. The use of 鬼, although seemingly unrelated in meaning, aligns with phonetic representation typical in many Chinese characters.

examples.chinese: 古代将领持戣(古代將領持戣)，冲破敌阵(衝破敵陣)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔdài jiānglǐng chí kuí, chōngpò dí zhèn.
examples.english: Ancient generals wielded the kuí to break enemy lines.

examples.chinese: 英雄举起戣(英雄舉起戣)，迎战强敌(迎戰強敵)。
examples.english: The hero raised the kuí to confront formidable foes.

examples.chinese: 那把雕刻精美的戣(那把雕刻精美的戣)，在战场上叱咤风云(在戰場上叱咤風雲)。
examples.pinyin: Nà bǎ diāokè jīngměi de kuí, zài zhànchǎng shàng chìchà fēngyún.
examples.english: That exquisitely carved kuí dominated the battlefield.
